}} 'Lactate dehydrogenase' ('LDH' or 'LD') is an enzyme () present in a wide
variety of organisms, including plants and animals.

Lactate dehydrogenases exist in four distinct enzyme classes. Two of them are
cytochrome c-dependent enzymes, each acting on either D-lactate (EC 1.1.2.4) or
L-lactate (EC 1.1.2.3). The other two are NAD(P)-dependent enzymes, each acting
on either D-lactate (EC 1.1.1.28) or L-lactate (EC 1.1.1.27). This article is
about the NAD(P)-dependent L-lactate dehydrogenase.
